value:
Soon I'll be back in my general's
uniform and set to patrol the nearby
villages. But until then...I'll endure.

Before this, I served as a knight in
Emperor Vigarde's employ. And now I
am expected to...relax at the beach.

From time to time, I wonder about
that child who was so desperate to
reclaim her dragonstone.$k$pI wonder if I'll find one that
resembles it on the beach.
Sorry...I was just thinking out loud.

When heated, the fluorspar rock
glimmers. Perhaps this summer I can
emulate it to live up to my namesake.

Here, have a cold drink. Hm? I bear
no ulterior motives. We are only
sharing each other's company.

I am General Selena, Fluorspar of the
Grado Empire. I bring summer tidings
from $Nf.
For the glory of the Grado Empire!

No matter what I wear or where
I fight, the pillars of knighthood
still guide my path.

The heat's making me sluggish... But
I can't let it overcome me now!

With this power... Why, I feel like I
could move oceans in his honor!

I am General Selena, Fluorspar of the
Grado Empire. Many battles await me.
Beach battles, I've been told.

Do you have a moment? I'd like to
tell you about my birthplace.$k$pI grew up in an impoverished village,
the sort of place where many lost
their lives to the cold, harsh winters.$k$pAs for me, I was saved by the grace
and benevolence of Emperor Vigarde
of the Grado Empire.$k$pNo matter the state of the empire, I
will always cherish his gratitude and
look fondly on those memories.$k$pI'll admit, the warm rays shining down
on me at the beach remind me of
his majesty, for he was my sun.$k$pSomeday, I hope my presence can
comfort others like that. Long may
we shine in the summer sun.
たあっ
これで！
きゃっ…
波が…！
Steel yourself!
Gawk elsewhere!
Here comes the undertow!
Sleep on the seabed!
So cold...
ふう…
I'm still General Selena, the Fluorspar of the Grado Empire. Don't you forget it.
You'd best hold yourself back. I won't warn you again.
I'm not used to wearing impractical attire while fighting.
Beautiful...? Me? Surely we have more pressing matters to discuss.
I welcome the radiant sun. It's a far cry from the dreariness of my village in winter...
Ah, breathing in the fresh sea air would do well for His Majesty's health.
You taught me joy I had never known. For that, you have my sincerest gratitude.
Understood.
I'll go forward.
Let's jump in!
